metadata.title: CVE-2020-7212 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The _encode_invalid_chars function in util/url.py in the urllib3 library1.25.2 through 1.25.7 for Python allows a denial of service (CPUconsumption) because of an inefficient algorithm. The percent_encodingsarray contains all matches of percent encodings. It is not deduplicated.For a URL of length N, the size of percent_encodings may be up to O(N). Thenext step (normalize existing percent-encoded bytes) also takes up to O(N)for each step, so the total time is O(N^2). If percent_encodings werededuplicated, the time to compute _encode_invalid_chars would be O(kN),where k is at most 484 ((10+6*2)^2).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-urllib3 - 1.25.8-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-urllib3 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.25.8-2').
